publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3620 John Park: 25th Anniversary of the Miners’ Strike—That the Parliament notes that 8 March 2009 is the 25th anniversary of the National Union of Mineworkers National Executive Committee granting special permission to members to take strike action in defence of jobs; recalls that Polmaise in Stirlingshire was one of the first proposed pit closures that prompted the national industrial action; remembers those who died while on picket lines; further remembers the pivotal role of women’s groups in supporting families and mining communities during the strike; recognises the devastating impact that the pit closures and dispute had on communities across Scotland; understands the importance that the miners’ strike plays in the history of trade union relations in the United Kingdom, and welcomes the positive and constructive role that trade unions continue to play in the modern workplace and their vital involvement in areas such as health and safety, equalities and trade union learning.
